title: Saracens miss out on bonus point in stuttering win over Gloucester-Hartpury
text:
Saracens 15-7 Gloucester Hartpury

Saracens missed out on a sixth consecutive bonus point as they stuttered to victory over Gloucester Hartpury - handing the reins to Harlequins at the top of the Tyrrells Premier 15s heading into the international break.

That it took the defending champions half an hour to break Gloucester’s defensive dam underlined the intent from the West Country side. Sitting in third, Susie Appleby's side were looking to narrow the gap at the summit of the league, where earlier in the day table-toppers Harlequins survived a scare at Loughborough to recover a 17-0 deficit to triumph 36-27.

Even in the absence of their captain and talismanic scrum-half Natasha Hunt, the Cherry and Whites more than matched the hosts until Hannah Botterman crashed over from a routine driving maul on the half hour mark, before Marlie Packer followed up with a try of her own.

But for large pockets of the game, Saracens struggled to imprint their brand of free-flowing rugby as indiscipline crept in, the hosts strayed offside twice in quick succession to gift Hartpury a scrum five metres out, allowing Erica Mills to squeeze through a sea of bodies en route to the whitewash with Lleucu George slotting home the extras.
